author: sky.cactus
content: The only reason one would want to stay on Goerli is because either you need to integrate with a bunch of stuff that is on Goerli (network effects are strong), or because your software relies on centralized infrastructure that only supports Goerli.  For the latter case, I don't care to support those people.  For the former case, I think we *want* to give weak incentives to start migrating to Sepolia specifically because strong network effects make the process slow.

author: parithosh
content:
In our current paradigm, Goerli is our only public way to test being a validator before doing it on mainnet. Plenty of staking providers use it as a form of staging before mainnet. 

We have plans for ephermeral testnets, etc - but we don't know if they work. So our current only option is to keep goerli alive as a service we provide to the staking community. They can't migrate away at all, dapp devs can and probably should.

author: parithosh
content: We could probably drop some sep.ETH to dapps that we can identify on goerli, to make it easier for them to move? We have much lower supply constraints anyway

author: parithosh
content: Even if we deprecate goerli and have sepolia as the only testnet, we'd still need to solve the problem of having a really large beaconchain in order to ensure we don't deploy things that can't work at mainnet size. So either we'd need another testnet or we can find a way to keep goerli around.

author: ajsutton
content: One other factor here is that we haven't been able to add validators to goerli fast enough to keep up with mainnet which reduces its usefulness as a testnet for consensus client devs testing as well.  Periodically starting new testnets for validators to test on, with as many validators as we care to shove into the genesis state, would make it much easier to keep up with mainnet validator count.

author: potuz
content: The one thing we lose with launching new testnets for CL teams is the non trivial topology of the network. I'd suspect that Goerli is more useful with less validators than a testnet with twice as many validators concentrated in 4 clusters

author: ajsutton
content: True, I'd say both large validator set and distributed are very useful. Goerli is well behind mainnet on both counts these days though.

author: ajsutton
content: That said, distribution would be a lot worse if dapps weren't running on the testnet since you basically wouldn't have any non-validating nodes.
